Posts.Content: Jul 23, 2009 06:01AM Amazon_Archer wrote: cwrightrn, I am 17 days out from total right mastectomy and I too still have a drain in that is putting out 70 cc a day. This is my second go around. My first time was 17 years ago and let me tell you of my initial experience. The first time I was diagonoised they removed my drains the same time they removed the staples, 10 days post-op. Within 48 hours I was vomiting every 15 minutes and had constant hiccups 24/7. I was rehospitalizied and spent the next 24 days in the hospital. Apparently they took the drains out to soon and the fluid build up was to much for my body to absorb. I went from 140 pounds down to 92 pounds. Once the fluid finally got to a point where my body could acutally absorb it I was fine. So this time around, I don't care how long the drain has to stay in, it's staying until i'm down to 30 cc or less in 24 hours. It is a nuisance, an irritant and just a royal pain in the tush, but I never want to have to go through again what I did the first time by pulling the drains to soon. Hang in there, it will slow down to the point where they can remove them safely without any ill effects for you.

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2009 03:11PM Amazon_Archer wrote: The brand I buy "Fruit of the Earth" is 100% all natural aloe vera. There is no alcohol in it. I'm only 3 weeks post op and I got an infection at my surgery sight, so no shaving or deodorant until the infection clears and the open wound closes. What happened was 2 pieces of surgical tape came off in the shower and when it did the skin came with it and left 2 open wounds that got infected, so the healing is taking longer then normal. My dear mother is actually the one that suggested I try the aloe vera and like I stated earlier I'm surprised how well it's working.
